context: This evaluation assesses how effectively an engineer uses the jquery-minicolors package API to implement a theme customizer widget. The criteria focus exclusively on proper usage of package-specific functions, methods, and configuration options.

checklist.name: Swatches initialization
checklist.description: Uses the 'swatches' option during initialization with the correct array of 5 preset colors: ['#3498db', '#2ecc71', '#e74c3c', '#34495e', '#ecf0f1']

checklist.name: Initial configuration
checklist.description: Configures the color picker with correct initial settings: 'control: wheel', 'format: rgb', 'opacity: true', and 'position: top right'

checklist.name: Settings method usage
checklist.description: Uses the .minicolors('settings', {...}) method to dynamically update configuration when switching modes

checklist.name: Mode-specific settings
checklist.description: Correctly updates 'control', 'format', and 'opacity' settings based on mode: simple mode uses 'hue' control with 'hex' format and opacity false; advanced mode uses 'wheel' control with 'rgb' format and opacity true

checklist.name: Object notation value
checklist.description: Uses .minicolors('value', {color: colorValue, opacity: 0.85}) with object notation to set both color and opacity atomically in the applyPresetColor function

checklist.name: rgbObject method
checklist.description: Calls .minicolors('rgbObject') method to retrieve the current color as an object with r, g, b, and a properties

checklist.name: rgbaString method
checklist.description: Calls .minicolors('rgbaString') method to retrieve the current color as a CSS-ready RGBA string

checklist.name: Return format structure
checklist.description: Returns an object from getColorInfo with properties 'rgbObject' and 'cssString' containing the results from the respective minicolors methods
